options.name: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

customVariables.name: Weeks into pregnancy when gave birth

options.name: Provide contact information including your phone number, address, email, social media contact information, and contact information of relatives and friends.

Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires on a computer, tablet or phone. These will include questions about your medical and pregnancy history, your current pregnancy, mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background.
Provide some biological samples from yourself that include the following:
A urine sample of about 6-7 tablespoons
A blood sample taken from a vein in your arm of about 1 ½ tablespoons
A saliva sample collected by spitting/drooling into a tube or having a cheek swab

Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about yourself and your infant including questions about the last part of pregnancy, your mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background, your baby’s health. You will be asked to complete these on a computer, tablet, or phone.
Have your child wear 2 small devices in a set of legwarmers with pockets for 3 continuous days. This will measure their movement and sleep cycles.
Have your child wear 1 small device on the arm for 3 continuous days to measure their heart rate, and answer a few questions about your child's activities while wearing this device
Have measurements taken of your child’s weight, length and head size
Consent to release of medical records for your pregnancy and for your child
Provide some biological samples from yourself:
A sample of toenail or fingernail clippings (about the thickness of a quarter from all 10 nails)
A saliva sample collected by spitting/drooling into a tube or having a cheek swab
Provide some biological samples from your child:
A urine sample of approximately 2-3 tablespoons
A saliva sample collected by collecting saliva in a tube or swabbing the inside of the cheek
A stool sample collected from your child’s diaper
Have a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain
Have a mock magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain
You will be asked to complete a brief survey of your experience with the research procedures at the end of the visit.

Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about yourself and your infant including questions about your mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background, your baby’s health. You will be asked to answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about your child’s behavior and relationships. You will be asked to complete these on a computer, tablet, or phone
Have your child wear 2 small devices in a set of legwarmers with pockets for 3 continuous days. This will measure their movement and sleep cycles
Have your child wear 1 small device on the arm for 3 continuous days to measure their heart rate, and answer a few questions about your child's activities while wearing this device
Have measurements taken of your child’s weight, length and head size
Consent to release of medical records for your pregnancy and for your child
Provide a saliva sample from yourself by spitting/drooling into a tube or having your cheek swabbed
Allow us to collect some biological samples from your child:
A saliva sample collected by collecting saliva in a tube or swabbing the inside of the cheek
A stool sample collected from your child’s diaper
A urine sample of approximately 2-3 tablespoons
Have a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain
Have a mock MRI scan of your child’s brain
Have an electroencephalogram (EEG) test of your child’s brain functioning that includes video recording of your child during the procedure
Have a mock electroencephalogram test of your child's brain functioning

Complete several activities with your child that are age appropriate and then do a brief activity in which we will ask you to rank goals and values that are important to you as a parent. You and your child will be video recorded during these activities.
You will be asked to complete a brief survey of your experience with the research procedures at the end of the visit.

customVariables.name: Used prenatal vitamins during current pregnancy

textTemplates.name: Biosensor V02 Follow Up Day 1
textTemplates.message:
Hi,

As part of your participation in the HBCD study, we would like you to complete a set of questionnaires using the link below. 

Thank you,
HBCD Team

You may open the survey queue in your web browser by clicking the link below:
https://integration.hbcd.ahc.umn.edu/rd/{{participant_global_id}}/V02.1

This link is unique to you and should not be forwarded to others.
